channel.title: CVE Feed for Tenable -- Nessus
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Tenable -- Nessus

item.title: CVE-2019-3962|2024-08-04T19:26:27.620Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: Content Injection vulnerability in Tenable Nessus prior to 8.5.0 may allow an authenticated, local attacker to exploit this vulnerability by convincing another targeted Nessus user to view a malicious URL and use Nessus to send fraudulent messages. Successful exploitation could allow the authenticated adversary to inject arbitrary text into the feed status, which will remain saved post session expiration.

item.title: CVE-2024-0955|2024-08-01T18:26:29.995Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: A stored XSS vulnerability exists where an authenticated, remote attacker with administrator privileges on the Nessus application could alter Nessus proxy settings, which could lead to the execution of remote arbitrary scripts.

item.title: CVE-2024-0971|2024-08-01T18:26:30.266Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: A SQL injection vulnerability exists where an authenticated, low-privileged remote attacker could potentially alter scan DB content.

item.title: CVE-2024-0971|2024-02-06T23:38:32.704Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: A SQL injection vulnerability exists where an authenticated, low-privileged remote attacker could potentially alter scan DB content.

item.title: CVE-2024-0955|2024-02-06T23:34:19.528Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: A stored XSS vulnerability exists where an authenticated, remote attacker with administrator privileges on the Nessus application could alter Nessus proxy settings, which could lead to the execution of remote arbitrary scripts.

item.title: CVE-2024-3290|2024-06-04T17:33:23.900Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: A race condition vulnerability exists where an authenticated, local attacker on a Windows Nessus host could modify installation parameters at installation time, which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code on the Nessus host

item.title: CVE-2024-3289|2024-06-06T17:35:56.532Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: When installing Nessus to a directory outside of the default location on a Windows host, Nessus versions prior to 10.7.3 did not enforce secure permissions for sub-directories. This could allow for local privilege escalation if users had not secured the directories in the non-default installation location.

item.title: CVE-2024-0971|2024-07-05T17:21:39.898Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: A SQL injection vulnerability exists where an authenticated, low-privileged remote attacker could potentially alter scan DB content.

item.title: CVE-2024-0955|2024-07-05T17:22:40.739Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: A stored XSS vulnerability exists where an authenticated, remote attacker with administrator privileges on the Nessus application could alter Nessus proxy settings, which could lead to the execution of remote arbitrary scripts.

item.title: CVE-2024-3289|2024-08-01T20:05:08.242Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: When installing Nessus to a directory outside of the default location on a Windows host, Nessus versions prior to 10.7.3 did not enforce secure permissions for sub-directories. This could allow for local privilege escalation if users had not secured the directories in the non-default installation location.

item.description: A race condition vulnerability exists where an authenticated, local attacker on a Windows Nessus host could modify installation parameters at installation time, which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code on the Nessus host
